intro: Mesembryanthemum anceps, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to drought conditions. Its flowering period usually occurs in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Mesembryanthemum anceps is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its low maintenance and ornamental value.
